#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Brazilian Medicine Council against Cuban privileges
#Text=Monday , February 14 , 2005

#Text=The Brazilian Regional Council of Medicine has protested against a Ministry of Education decision to accept the diplomas of Cuban medical school graduates without subjecting them to a more rigorous evaluation process .

#Text=Under the Brazilian 44045 Edict of July 19 , 1958 , all students of Medicine , Brazilian or non-Brazilian , who studied in a foreign institution must undergo a strict evaluation before their professional registration is granted .
#Text=The law aims to ensure that the physicians who graduated at foreign universities are properly prepared for and familiarized with the particular medical conditions of Brazil .
#Text=Some diseases like malaria and dengue for example are very rare in some countries but are more common in Brazilian territory .
#Text=However the Brazilian Ministry of Education ( MEC ) has come to an agreement with the Cuban government to allow medical students who studied in Cuba to go through a less rigorous examination .
#Text=Furthermore the MEC wants to exempt the students from the Cuban Escola Latino Americana de Medicina ( Latin American Medicine School ) or ELAM located in Havana from the examination .
#Text=Under the agreement , the diplomas of ELAM students would be automatically recognized as valid in Brazil .
#Text=The Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva signed the endorsement of this agreement last year during his visit to Cuba .
#Text=The Brazilian Regional Council of Medicine from São Paulo is opposed to the idea of accepting the Cuban diplomas and is to dispute the deal in Court .
#Text=The council says the government decision is unfair and disadvantages Brazilian students .
#Text=It also says that the decision puts the Brazilian community at risk because of differences between Cuban and Brazilian medical education .
#Text=Cuban physicians are prepared for Cuban conditions and necessities in health which differ from Brazilian ones .

#Text=Additionally the council argues that the decision is against the law because the Brazilian 44045 Edict demands that all medical students from foreign schools have to pass a careful examination .
#Text=The Cuban First Secretary of Technical and Scientific Collaboration in Health , Filisberto Perez , recognizes that both Brazil and Cuba have different models of apprenticeship in medicine .
#Text=However he believes that Cuba and Brazil can recognize each other 's diplomas without difficulty .
#Text=Early this year , a team of Brazilian inspectors visited the leading medical schools in Cuba to evaluate them so the degrees can be formalized .
#Text=The MEC 's decision has angered some Brazilian students .

#Text=" Why would I study for two years so I could get admitted to a Brazilian school if it would be easier to " buy " my diploma in Cuba ? " asks Artur Oliveira Mendes in a email sent to a academic organization .
#Text=He added : " ... our schools of medicine are demoralized before the president 's declaration .
